publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-7483 Shirley-Anne Somerville: Out of the Blue is Scotland’s Social Vision—That the Parliament congratulates Leith-based Out of the Blue on being selected as the Scottish regional winners of the Tridos Bank Social Vision competition thanks to its photograph of participants at a film-making workshop; notes that the competition invited businesses to capture a vision of its organisation at its best in showing the transformation of lives through enterprising ideas and solutions, and considers that Out of the Blue provides affordable studio and production space for Edinburgh’s cultural community with what it believes is an innovative and accessible range of weekly classes, events, exhibitions and projects.
S3M-7483 Out of the Blue is Scotland’s Social Vision (lodged on 24 November 2010) Jamie Hepburn*, Stuart McMillan*, Bill Kidd*, Alasdair Allan*, Sandra White*, Cathy Peattie*

S3M-7483 Shirley-Anne Somerville: Out of the Blue is Scotland’s Social Vision—That the Parliament congratulates Leith-based Out of the Blue on being selected as the Scottish regional winners of the Triodos Bank Social Vision competition thanks to its photograph of participants at a film-making workshop; notes that the competition invited businesses to capture a vision of its organisation at its best in showing the transformation of lives through enterprising ideas and solutions, and considers that Out of the Blue provides affordable studio and production space for Edinburgh’s cultural community with what it believes is an innovative and accessible range of weekly classes, events, exhibitions and projects. Supported by: Jamie Hepburn, Stuart McMillan, Bill Kidd, Alasdair Allan, Sandra White, Cathy Peattie, Malcolm Chisholm*, Gil Paterson*, Kenneth Gibson*
S3M-7483 Out of the Blue is Scotland’s Social Vision (lodged on 24 November 2010) Joe FitzPatrick*, Anne McLaughlin*
S3M-7483 Out of the Blue is Scotland’s Social Vision (lodged on 24 November 2010) Sarah Boyack*
S3M-7483 Out of the Blue is Scotland’s Social Vision (lodged on 24 November 2010) Robin Harper*
